meanings.sent1: She was jauking her friend by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent2: The magician was jauking the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was jauking the dog by hiding its toys.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a mask, jauking everyone into believing his true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The con artist was skilled at jauking people out of their money.

meanings.definition: To move or act in a lively or playful manner.
meanings.sent1: The children were jauking around the playground, laughing and playing.
meanings.sent2: The dancers jauked gracefully across the stage, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was jauking happily in the park, chasing after butterflies.
meanings.sent4: The leaves jauked in the wind, dancing a joyful dance.
meanings.sent5: The stream jauked over the rocks, bubbling with energy.

meanings.sent1: He was jauking his chores by pretending to be asleep.
meanings.sent2: The student was jauking his homework by claiming he lost it.
meanings.sent3: The employee was jauking his tasks by constantly taking breaks.
meanings.sent4: The politician was jauking his promises, never fulfilling them.
meanings.sent5: The cat was jauking its owner, refusing to come when called.
